official-title.#text: To provide for parental notification and intervention in the case of an unemancipated minor seeking an abortion.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Parental Notification and Intervention Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

It shall be unlawful for any person or organization in or affecting interstate or foreign commerce or who solicits or accepts Federal funds to perform any abortion on an unemancipated minor under the age of 18, to permit the facilities of the person or organization to be used to perform any abortion on such a minor, or to assist in the performance of any abortion on such a minor if the person or organization has failed to comply with all of the following requirements:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) of the minor informing the parents that an abortion has been requested for the minor, except that such notification is not required for a parent if there is clear and convincing evidence of physical abuse of the minor by such parent.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Parental Notification and Intervention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:e

text.#text: The provision of written notification to the parents (as defined in
Compliance with a 96-hour waiting period after notice has been received by the parents.
Compliance with any injunction granted under section 3 relating to the abortion.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be fined not more than $100,000 or imprisoned not more than one year, or both, for each violation.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Parental Notification and Intervention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: Whoever willfully violates

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply with respect to an unemancipated minor for whom an abortion is sought if a physician (other than the physician with principal responsibility for making the decision to perform the abortion) makes a determination that—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Parental Notification and Intervention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: a medical emergency exists which, with reasonable medical certainty, so complicates the medical condition of the minor that the death of the minor would result from the failure to immediately treat her physical condition even though the treatment may result in the death of her unborn child;
parental notification is not possible as a result of the medical emergency; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Parental Notification and Intervention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: have been entered in the medical records of the minor, together with the reasons upon which the determinations are based, including a statement of relevant clinical findings.

text.#text: certifications regarding compliance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Parental Notification and Intervention Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: For purposes of this section, any parental notification provided to comply with the provisions of
delivered personally to the parent; or
provided through certified mail in accordance with all of the following procedures:
The certified mail is addressed to the parent.
The address used is the dwelling or usual place of abode of the parent.
A return receipt is requested.
The delivery is restricted to the parent.

term.#tail: includes, with respect to an unemancipated minor, any legal guardian of the minor.

text.#text: For purposes of this Act, the term

header.#text: Parent defined To include legal guardian

text.#text: Any parent required to be notified pursuant to section 2 regarding an abortion of an unemancipated minor may bring an action in the Federal district court where the parent resides or where the unemancipated minor is located to enjoin the performance of the abortion. The court shall issue a temporary injunction barring the performance of the abortion until the issue has been adjudicated and the judgment is final. The court shall issue relief permanently enjoining the abortion unless the court determines that granting such relief would be unlawful.

Nothing in this Act shall be construed to preempt any provision of State law to the extent that such State law establishes, implements, or continues in effect greater parental notification requirements or intervention rights regarding abortion than those provided under this Act.
The provisions of this Act shall take effect upon its enactment.

The provisions of this Act shall be severable. If any provision of this Act, or any application thereof, is found unconstitutional, that finding shall not affect any provision or application of the Act not so adjudicated.
